events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision on a busy highway during rush hour.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after review of the accident description and keywords.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this vehicle collision claim and coordinate with the claimant.
The insurance team acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer of timely processing.
Requested submission of police report, photos of damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with assessment.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including police report, photos, and repair quotes promptly.
Investigation began focusing on circumstances of the vehicle collision and validation of submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damage assessment was consistent with evidence.
A settlement amount covering full repair costs was proposed and communicated to the customer for approval.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claims process.
The claim approval was finalized following receipt of customer agreement on the proposed settlement amount.
Insurance payment was issued to the customerâ€™s account to cover the vehicle repair costs as per agreement.
The claim was formally closed after confirming payment receipt and satisfaction from the insured party.
All claim documents and communication were archived in compliance with company policy for future reference.
